term.name: expressionism
term.source: From English express: to represent something (especially a thought or feeling) in words or images.
term.def: A school of &modernism; holding that the essential function of art is to provide a vehicle for the subjective experience or emotional expressions of the artist. Expressionist art could be either representational (as in Edvard Munch's painting "The Scream") or abstract (as in the work of painters such as Jackson Pollock and in critical theories such as those of Clement Greenberg).
The view that value judgments are merely expressions of emotion; another term for &emotivism;.
